p: Recently, Chen et al. observed 2 patients with autopsy-confirmed PSP harboring duplications spanning the entire MAPT locus (both copy number = 3) through genome-wide survey of copy number variants (CNVs) and proposed that MAPT duplications may be a genetic cause of PSP, which provides genetic evidence for the hypothesis that CNVs are associated with PSP [ 22] and indicates that there are more potential associations between MAPT and PSP.
